title.narrative: Learning, Equity and Accountability Program Support Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve the quality of grades 1 to 3 reading and math skills of children in Target Regions and Target Schools, with a special focus on those belonging to Target Disadvantaged Groups.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :DLI Verification Protocol | Description :Borrower’s obligation to carry out the Project, and monitor and reporton the achievement of the Disbursement Linked Indicators, in accordance with the arrangements and procedures set out in the DLIVerification Protocol | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Indigenous Peoples Planning Framework | Description :Borrower’s obligation to ensure that the Project isimplemented in accordance with the Indigenous Peoples Planning Framework. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements | Description :Borrower’s obligation to maintain, throughout the implementation ofthe Project, an executive committee chaired by DepEd, a DepEd project management office, and operational units of DepEd at central,region, division, and school levels, all assigned with functions, responsibilities and resources for the Project, satisfactory tothe Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Interim Unaudited Financial Reports | Description :Semi-annual interim unaudited financial reports, whichinclude details of the Eligible Expenditure Programs | Frequency :SemiAnnual
Finance Agreement :Project Reports; Mid-Term Review | Description :Borrower’s obligation to prepare and furnish semi-annual projectreports and a mid-term report. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Verification Agent | Description :Borrower’s obligation to appoint and retain for the duration of the Project anindependent DLI verification agent having qualifications and terms of reference acceptable to the Bank to verify the achievement ofthe DLIs semi-annually. | Due Date :14-Dec-2014

title.narrative: Comprehensive review completed on selected DepEd programs serving the Target Disadvantaged Groups in the Target Regions
Development of enabling policy environment for the use of school report cards (SRC) in the Target Regions

target.value: Policy on SRC adopted and 13,415 target schools use refined SRC

actual.value: DepEd order 44, 2015 adopted; DVA verification of 8,474 schools using enhanced SRC has been reviewed by the Bank and considered tohaving been met at 88%.

title.narrative: Financial management capacity of DepEd central, regional and division offices improved

target.value: FM manual adopted and relevant staff trained

actual.value: Manual adopted and national training completed. Bank currently reviewing DVA report on the numbers of staff having been trained.

title.narrative: Improvement of data management for educational programs serving the Target Disadvantaged Groups in the Target Regions.

target.value: Information strategy developed and information system implemented

actual.value: Office order 042 - 2017 adopted on May 22, 2017 on info strategy in support of programs serving disadvantaged groups. However,progress on developing information system based on the strategy continues to be delayed.

title.narrative: Capability of DepEd to implement its Performance Incentive Scheme improved

actual.value: PMS developed and DVA confirmed that based on a sampling of 400 schools, 13,612 staff have been trained compared to the finaltarget of 14,173. However, this indicator is considered to be achieved as more staff are being trained beyond the DLI verificationperiod and is likely to exceed the target number. For disbursement purposes, this DLI is considered 100% achieved.

title.narrative: Development of an enabling environment for the effective implementation of the grades 1 to 3 reading and math programs in the Target Regions

target.value: Policy on: (i) EGRA and EGMA utilization and (ii) the inclusion of early literacy and numeracy courses in DepEd's teacher inductionprogram adopted.

actual.value: Policy on EGRA and EGMA utilization adopted. DepEd order 43, s. 2017 on the new teacher induction program policy was issued on Aug.11, 2017, which includes courses on EGRA and EGMA.

title.narrative: School heads from identified schools trained to strengthen the field level support system for improved early grade reading and mathteaching.
Teachers from identified schools trained to improve their capability to effectively teach grades 1 to 3 reading and math
Linguistic map for each Target Region developed for improved targeting and implementation of the grades 1 to 3 reading and math programs
Versions of EGRA and EGMA tools developed for each selected Mother Tongue in each Target Region
For learners living in remote or difficult-to-access areas
Increase of students from disadvantaged groups with at least 60% scores in the relevant EGMA-mother tongue tool
For learners who attend schools with high concentration of IP students (66% or higher)
Increase of students with at least 60% scores in the relevant EGMA-mother tongue tool
For learners who attend schools with high concentration of IP students (66% or higher)
Decrease of students with scores of zero in the Comprehension domain subtest of the relevant EGRA-mother tongue tool
Decrease of students from disadvantaged groups with scores of zero in the Comprehension domain subtest of the relevant EGRA-mother tongue tool
For learners living in remote or difficult-to-access areas
